birth_place.zh-cn: 清朝江苏省江阴南沙镇马桥村殷家埭
birth_place.en: Yinjiadai, Maqiao Village, Nansha Town, Jiangyin, Jiangsu, Qing dynasty

description.zh-cn: 中国诗人、杂文家、语言学者、摄影理论家，新文化运动的重要人物。
description.en: A Chinese poet, essayist, linguist, and photography theorist, an important figure in the New Culture Movement.

description.zh-cn: 中国音乐家，刘半农之弟。
description.en: A Chinese musician, younger brother of Liu Bannong.

description.zh-cn: 中国音乐家，刘半农之弟。
description.en: A Chinese musician, younger brother of Liu Bannong.

description.zh-cn: 刘半农的出生地。
description.en: The birthplace of Liu Bannong.

description.zh-cn: 刘半农曾就读并任教的小学。
description.en: The primary school where Liu Bannong studied and taught.

description.zh-cn: 刘半农曾就读的中学。
description.en: The high school where Liu Bannong studied.

description.zh-cn: 翰墨林小学校长，曾聘请刘半农回校任教。
description.en: Principal of Hanmolin Primary School, who invited Liu Bannong to teach at the school.

description.zh-cn: 曾与刘半农共同编辑《江阴杂志》。
description.en: Co-edited the 'Jiangyin Magazine' with Liu Bannong.

description.zh-cn: 刘半农曾在此任编辑的剧社。
description.en: An opera society where Liu Bannong worked as an editor.

description.zh-cn: 曾介绍刘半农至中华书局任职。
description.en: Introduced Liu Bannong to a position at the Zhonghua Book Company.

description.zh-cn: 刘半农曾在此任编译员的出版机构。
description.en: A publishing house where Liu Bannong worked as a compiler and translator.

description.zh-cn: 中国教育家，曾邀请刘半农至北京大学任教。
description.en: A Chinese educator who invited Liu Bannong to teach at Peking University.

description.zh-cn: 刘半农曾任教及担任教授的大学。
description.en: The university where Liu Bannong taught and held a professorship.

description.zh-cn: 新文化运动中的重要刊物，刘半农曾任其编委。
description.en: An influential magazine during the New Culture Movement, where Liu Bannong served on the editorial board.

description.zh-cn: 一场发生于1919年的中国反帝、反封建的爱国运动，刘半农曾声援运动中被捕的学生。
description.en: An anti-imperialist, anti-feudal, and patriotic movement in China in 1919, during which Liu Bannong supported the arrested students.

description.zh-cn: 刘半农曾在此学习的大学。
description.en: The university where Liu Bannong studied.

description.zh-cn: 刘半农获得国家文学博士学位的大学。
description.en: The university from which Liu Bannong obtained his state doctorate in literature.

description.zh-cn: 中国语言文字学家，曾邀请刘半农至辅仁大学任职。
description.en: A Chinese linguist and philologist who invited Liu Bannong to a position at Fu Jen Catholic University.

description.zh-cn: 刘半农曾在此担任教务长和附中主任的大学。
description.en: The university where Liu Bannong served as Dean of Studies and director of the affiliated high school.

description.zh-cn: 日本于1931年侵占中国东北的事件，此事变后刘半农积极主张抗日救国。
description.en: The 1931 incident where Japan invaded and occupied Northeast China, after which Liu Bannong actively advocated for resisting Japan and saving the nation.

description.zh-cn: 1934年刘半农率队前往绥远、内蒙一带进行的方言调查活动，期间他不幸染病逝世。
description.en: A dialect survey expedition to Suiyuan and Inner Mongolia led by Liu Bannong in 1934, during which he unfortunately contracted an illness and passed away.

description.zh-cn: 刘半农逝世的城市。
description.en: The city where Liu Bannong passed away.

description.zh-cn: 刘半农创作的白话情诗，推广了汉字“她”的使用。
description.en: A vernacular love poem written by Liu Bannong, which popularized the use of the Chinese character '她' (she).

description.zh-cn: 20世纪初中国的文化和思想启蒙运动，刘半农是其重要参与者。
description.en: A cultural and intellectual enlightenment movement in early 20th-century China, in which Liu Bannong was a key participant.

description.zh-cn: 由刘半农与李家瑞合著的关于俗字研究的著作。
description.en: A work on the study of popular characters co-authored by Liu Bannong and Li Jiarui.

description.zh-cn: 与刘半农合著《宋元以来俗字谱》的学者。
description.en: A scholar who co-authored 'A譜 of Popular Characters since the Song and Yuan Dynasties' with Liu Bannong.

description.zh-cn: 刘半农是刘天华的兄长。
description.en: Liu Bannong was the elder brother of Liu Tianhua.

description.zh-cn: 刘半农是刘北茂的兄长。
description.en: Liu Bannong was the elder brother of Liu Beimao.

description.zh-cn: 刘半农出生于江苏江阴。
description.en: Liu Bannong was born in Jiangyin, Jiangsu.

description.zh-cn: 刘半农于1901年进入翰墨林小学学习。
description.en: Liu Bannong entered Hanmolin Primary School to study in 1901.

description.zh-cn: 刘半农于1907年入读常州中学，1911年毕业。
description.en: Liu Bannong enrolled in Changzhou High School in 1907 and graduated in 1911.

description.zh-cn: 1911年毕业后，刘半农受聘回翰墨林小学做教员。
description.en: After graduating in 1911, Liu Bannong was hired to return to Hanmolin Primary School as a teacher.

description.zh-cn: 时任翰墨林小学校长的王翊唐聘请刘半农回校任教。
description.en: Wang Yitang, then principal of Hanmolin Primary School, hired Liu Bannong to teach at the school.

description.zh-cn: 刘半农与吴研因等人共同编辑《江阴杂志》。
description.en: Liu Bannong co-edited the 'Jiangyin Magazine' with Wu Yanyin and others.

description.zh-cn: 1912年春，刘半农受邀在开明剧社任编辑，剧社于次年春解散。
description.en: In the spring of 1912, Liu Bannong was invited to be an editor at the Kaiming Opera Society, which disbanded the following spring.

description.zh-cn: 1913年，徐半梅介绍刘半农至中华书局任编译员。
description.en: In 1913, Xu Banmei introduced Liu Bannong to a position as a compiler and translator at the Zhonghua Book Company.

description.zh-cn: 自1913年起，刘半农在中华书局任编译员。
description.en: Starting in 1913, Liu Bannong worked as a compiler and translator at the Zhonghua Book Company.

description.zh-cn: 1917年夏，蔡元培邀请刘半农至北京大学预科任教。
description.en: In the summer of 1917, Cai Yuanpei invited Liu Bannong to teach at the preparatory school of Peking University.

position.zh-cn: 预科教员、国文系教授、研究所国学门导师
position.en: Preparatory School Teacher, Professor of the Department of Chinese Literature, Mentor at the Institute of Sinology

description.zh-cn: 刘半农于1917年任北京大学预科教员，1925年回国后任国文系教授兼研究所国学门导师。
description.en: Liu Bannong became a teacher at the preparatory school of Peking University in 1917, and after returning to China in 1925, he became a professor in the Department of Chinese Literature and a mentor at the Institute of Sinology.

description.zh-cn: 1917年起，刘半农担任《新青年》编委。
description.en: From 1917, Liu Bannong served as a member of the editorial board of 'New Youth'.

description.zh-cn: 在五四运动期间，刘半农曾声援被捕的学生。
description.en: During the May Fourth Movement, Liu Bannong supported the arrested students.

description.zh-cn: 1920年，刘半农赴欧洲留学，初于伦敦大学学习。
description.en: In 1920, Liu Bannong went to Europe to study, initially at the University of London.

description.zh-cn: 刘半农于1921年夏赴巴黎大学留学，1925年获得国家文学博士学位。
description.en: Liu Bannong went to study at the University of Paris in the summer of 1921 and obtained a state doctorate in literature in 1925.

description.zh-cn: 1929年7月，沈兼士邀请刘半农兼任辅仁大学教务长。
description.en: In July 1929, Shen Jianshi invited Liu Bannong to serve concurrently as the Dean of Studies at Fu Jen Catholic University.

position.zh-cn: 教务长、附中高中部主任
position.en: Dean of Studies, Director of the Affiliated High School Department

description.zh-cn: 刘半农于1929年7月兼任辅仁大学教务长，1930年12月兼任附中高中部主任。
description.en: Liu Bannong concurrently served as Dean of Studies at Fu Jen Catholic University from July 1929, and as director of the affiliated high school department from December 1930.

description.zh-cn: 九一八事变后，刘半农的政治立场转为积极主张抗日救国。
description.en: After the Mukden Incident, Liu Bannong's political stance shifted to actively advocating for resisting Japan and saving the nation.

description.zh-cn: 1934年6月，刘半农率队深入绥远、内蒙一带考察方言方音。
description.en: In June 1934, Liu Bannong led a team to conduct dialect research in the Suiyuan and Inner Mongolia regions.

description.zh-cn: 在考察途中，刘半农感染回归热，并因此于1934年7月14日逝世。
description.en: During the expedition, Liu Bannong contracted relapsing fever and passed away as a result on July 14, 1934.

description.zh-cn: 刘半农于1920年9月在伦敦创作了情诗《教我如何不想她》。
description.en: Liu Bannong wrote the love poem 'How Can I Not Miss Her' in London in September 1920.

description.zh-cn: 刘半农是新文化运动的重要人物。
description.en: Liu Bannong was an important figure in the New Culture Movement.

description.zh-cn: 刘半农与李家瑞合著了《宋元以来俗字谱》。
description.en: Liu Bannong co-authored 'A谱 of Popular Characters since the Song and Yuan Dynasties' with Li Jiarui.

description.zh-cn: 李家瑞与刘半农合著了《宋元以来俗字谱》。
description.en: Li Jiarui co-authored 'A谱 of Popular Characters since the Song and Yuan Dynasties' with Liu Bannong.
